alert.note: Alert for Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:41AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN SUFFOLK AND NORTHEASTERN NASSAU COUNTIES THROUGH 615 AM EDT... At 541 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bayville, or over Oyster Bay, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glen Cove, Syosset, Huntington, Northport, Oyster Bay, Bayville, Centerport, Cold Spring Harbor, Brookville, East Northport, Greenlawn, Fort Salonga, Sea Cliff, Glen Head, and Old Westbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
